channel.title: Annoying error
channel.description: Hi guys, I got no idea what this annoying error is being caused by! Its not allowing me to do anything with my client [code] Applet_Sub1.java:12: error while writing Applet_Sub1: Applet_Sub1.class (Access is denied) public class Applet_Sub1 extends Applet ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code] Please help!!

item.title: Annoying error
item.dc:creator: @CreatorAlex CreatorAlex
item.description:
@CreatorAlex wrote:

g s e:

Try Unhiding ever file u have , because i hid all mine for the error and when i deleted the class file it moved on to class one.

Here’s your problem, you have your java files hidden, so it’s not allowed to make remote changes to them. It will always give an error with the first hidden one it finds, in most cases being Applet_Sub1.

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying error
item.dc:creator: @nardoscape nardoscape
item.description:
@nardoscape wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:356401”][quote author=nardoscape link=topic=452937.msg3318249#msg3318249 date=1282490548]
Considering that the ^ is pointing to the “c” in class I’d say Capitalize it, thats all I know.
[/quote]

You sir/madam are a moron.[/quote]

Haha I’m a moron for trying to help someone, your a moron for insulting someone who was only trying to help, so I’m sorry, but your the moron buddy, enough said.

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying error
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

This is mainly a problem in Vista where the compiler doesn’t the have privileges to write, try disabling UAC.

Or, you have a write-protected Applet_Sub1.class in your output directory.

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying error
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

nardoscape:

Considering that the ^ is pointing to the “c” in class I’d say Capitalize it, thats all I know.

You sir/madam are a moron.

My guess is probably delete all the class files and try compiling. The class file might be in use.

Read full topic
